page.title: 04TOILETS WERE FREE STANDING
page.content: Outside at the back of the house there would be a semi-permanent construction or "outhouse" in which mother would store various items. The toilet would be a free standing structure near the house. These terraced houses originally belonged to the employer of the people living in them. Today however most are privately owned and have been modernised in the form of extensions to the original structure enabaling bathrooms and toilet facilities to be brought indoors. The second type, the council house built post-war to replace the more delapidated housing pre-war. These council owned properties were built as estates varing in size from small i.e. twenty houses to vary large i.e.one thousand plus. These had larger rooms advanced plumbing and toilets, gardens and outhouses.
